intro: Iberis ciliata var. welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's candytuft, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers and pungent aroma. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are white or pale yellow and are arranged in dense clusters.
